name: Keith
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
3 weeks ago
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: What a fabulous stay. First off, Staunton exceeded all expectations. It's incredibly charming with lots to see and do. Don't miss the performances at the Shakespeare theater in town. Secondly, you couldn't choose a more charming, peaceful, easy-to-use, comfortable, private place than Annie's. I spent hours out on the deck overlooking the forest, listening to and watching the birds (and deer!) and thinking - now THIS is a vacation. Thirdly, you couldn't ask for a better host. When we arrived, she'd obviously tried to think of EVERYTHING we might need to make us feel at home and made it available. She was quick to respond to questions and just so friendly. Simply put, it's the PERFECT AirBnB. Thank you so much, Annie.

Wow! Our stay at the Sweet Darling House was absolutely delightful. From the moment we arrived, we felt right at home thanks to the warm welcome from our hosts. Each room is beautiful and cozy, with so much attention to detail. We loved having our morning coffee on the back deck, soaking in the sounds of birds chirping. The dreamy backyard was the perfect spot to relax and unwind! The bed was incredibly comfortable, and we slept great.
We enjoyed taking walks to downtown, admiring the beautiful architecture of Staunton along the way.
The check-in process was smooth and convenient, with excellent communication from our hosts throughout our stay. Sweet Darling House is our favorite Airbnb experience, and we cannot wait to return.

We love to walk and didn't move our car except for an afternoon jaunt to Lexington. Everything we wanted to do was walkable from the apartment.
Would highly recommend and would do it again if the opportunity presents!

The apartment itself was stocked with everything we needed for our unexpected week away from home. It was cute and comfortable, and I cannot think of a single "area for improvement" - like, 10/10. As for the hosts, they were very communicative and provided all of the information that we needed ahead of our visit.
Thank you again!

Like others have mentioned, the WiFi speed could be pretty slow at times, I had some work to do there and that was the only issue I had. That's really not an issue at all though unless you gave to work. overall this was such a great place and you can walk just about anywhere you want. highly recommend!

For context, we live in Staunton (about a five-minute walk from the Airbnb, in fact) and needed a place to crash for the week - so there's a bit of a bias when I say that the location can't be beat. :) The space is directly across from an excellent brewery (Redbeard) and adjacent to an equally-excellent hard-cidery (Ciders from Mars), and within easy walking distance to all manner of restaurants and shops.
The apartment itself is located in a lovely historic building and was stocked with everything we needed for our unexpected week away from home. It was cute and comfortable, and I cannot think of a single "area for improvement" - like, 10/10. As for Laurie, she was friendly, quick to confirm my reservation (day-of booking) and very responsive to my inquiries.
Thank you again!

The Great:
-Location, Location, Location! I parked my car when I arrived in Staunton and didn't move it again until I departed.
-Terrific value for dollar.
-Quite Cozy. Loved the lived-in look of the place. It felt like I was visiting/staying with a friend
-Learned to operate a coffee press! (Printed directions in binder where perfect.)
-Sleep machine was terrific extra.
The slightly less than great:
-Loft is on surprizingly noisy street for such an small, adorable town. I was forewarned by previous guests' write-ups, so I was not surprized. If you're lookin' for quiet...this place is not for you.

We look forward to staying in Laurie's apartment the next time we visit Staunton.

Steep stairs with bike stored in hallway to navigate on way up to unit. Parking in front of building but it is a narrow, dark and busy street use caution. Great instructions by host. The art work and comfy sofa were highlights of the unit. Compared to other places we've stayed in Staunton it is a bit tired (cracked blinds, water stained tabletops, dated bathroom, minimalist kitchen) but price reflects that somewhat. There was dishsoap but no other cleaning supplies or wipes available for routine cleanups. Seems host was making some updates from "grad student loft" decor. Good price, great location, secure building.

Our stay at Laurie's place was great! We were in Staunton for several days for an event and the apartment was close to everything. Our friends were jealous that we had a place that was so convenient!
Good a/c, fast internet. Apartment was especially clean and had many nice touches such as a selection of teas and extra towels available.
Parking was available outside the door during most of our stay, but if not, there is a large parking garage less than a block away. It was easy to unload our stuff then put our car in the garage.
If we come back, I hope we will be able to stay there again.
Thank you!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The Lewis Creek Loft was perfect for our first foray into AirBnB. The Loft’s location was easy walking distance to the historical downtown Staunton and a variety of restaurants. We were interested in glass blowing which was perfect because Sunspots Studio was 400 feet from the Loft. We enjoy the arts and history. Staunton has both. In addition to glass blowing we toured Blackfriars theater and sat in on a rehearsal for a concert at Trinity Church, also just 400 feet from the Loft. Also a short distance is the historic railroad depot which is an Amtrak station and the starting point for the Virginia Scenic Railroad. We didn’t get to go on the train ride, but hope maybe the next time.
Laurie was the perfect host, her instructions were clear and she responded quickly to a number of questions. All in all we would definitely recommend Lewis Creek Loft to anyone.

name: Geoff

Rating, 4 stars

July 2023
,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text:
We stayed at Laurie’s place for 10 days in July. The location can’t be beat and the price is great. Laurie is quick to respond and provides detailed instructions. There are a couple of things that should be mentioned however. Keep in mind that these things wouldn’t necessarily have been issues for a shorter stay.
First, and I know this sounds odd: the toilet is tiny—like a child-size toilet. We are both tall (6’ 4” and 6’), and it was an an adventure getting onto and off of it. I’ve never encountered a toilet so small anywhere other than in an elementary school.
Second, the bed and the couch are uncomfortable. It was difficult to rest and relax after about the third day.
Third, the mini-split a/c unit is adequate for the living area and kitchen, but not the bedroom. This did not help with the sleeping situation. To be fair, there is a fan and that helped.
Staunton is a great place and Laurie is a great host and we enjoyed our stay in spite of the negatives.

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Great weekend! The apartment is accurately described and pictured in the listing, and check-in instructions were clear. My husband and I found this to be a great, cozy landing space for a weekend of fun in the area. Other than a tour at Polyface Farms, we walked everywhere - you can see the Saturday morning Farmer's Market outside the kitchen window. It's across the street from the beautiful Trinity Church (est 1746!) where we enjoyed Sunday morning worship. And downtown Staunton is an easy stroll for eating, drinking, and window shopping. Since it's so close to downtown, you can hear traffic from the apartment - don't think of this as a rural retreat. The sounds weren't too intrusive for us, but fan and the kindly supplied ear plugs in the bedroom would also help if needed. This is a great value in a great location. We enjoyed a refreshing weekend, and would gladly return.

review_text:
We had an amazing stay at Laurie’s loft! It was a clean, unique, cozy place to stay as my wife and I explored Staunton for the first time. It’s within walking distance of a whole lot of restaurants, shops, breweries, etc. Perfect location, but just far enough away from the main streets to avoid any real commotion. We stayed over St. Patrick’s Day weekend, and while you could hear passing cars pretty well from the bedroom, we didn’t hear any noises or partying at all. Laurie was thorough and friendly in her communication, and we would love to come stay again.
The only negative, at least for us: the mattress was really, really firm. At home, we have a pretty soft bed that you can really sink into, so we did not sleep very well. However, that’s just our preference, so we didn’t feel it deserved to lower our overall rating as it really was a great place to stay in an awesome town. Aside from the bed, we loved everything about this place and downtown Staunton! Thank you, Laurie!

Perfect does not exist but this IS STILL a solid 5 star spot to stay. Basically just the things others mentioned. It's not the quietest place but that's because... THE LOCATION IS SO AWESOME!!! It's right in the middle of it all. And parking though not a problem will take a little managing. Just follow the directions and you'll be fine especially around the weekends. Go here!!
AND bonus tip... if you want the best massage of your life visit Charles at Forever Relished nearby. We literally planned our entire stay around his availability. He moved away from our hometown to set up a spa in Stanton. We even traveled to visit him.
That good.
STANTON IS A LOVELY PLACE!!!! GO!

The Lewis Creek Loft is wonderful! It is tastefully appointed with a Parisian motif, well located, and in a fascinating town in Virginia's Blue Ridge. We enjoyed a long weekend as Laurie's guests, and felt well-taken care of at all times. There are so many activities and restaurants just outside the door, and even a farmer's market on Saturday mornings. Our visit was in late summer, but I am sure that the town is even lovelier when the leaves start to change. The building itself has an interesting story, and adds to the charm.
I would heartily recommend Laurie's Lewis Street Loft to anyone who wants to enjoy Staunton, Virginia's many charms!

name: Kim
rating_info:

,
·
August 2022
,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text: If you want to enjoy what downtown Staunton has to offer, Laurie's apartment could not be more convenient. There's a brew pub, a winery, a cidery, and a bistro with patio dining all less than a block away. Arts venues, the farmers' market, and main street shops are close as well. The apartment is unusual in giving the feeling that the owner had actually lived there and knew how to make it comfortable, with bedside reading lamps, a lap rug, and a very comfortable couch, as well as attractive, with its Paris-themed art. It was not noisy, despite the central location, and because the city wasn't busy, we found free parking on the street right outside most days and all nights during our nine-day stay. We would definitely return!

We were able to go up a street or so after 3 pm and there is no charge for parking after 5 pm so that was perfect. We usually came in around 3 pm and left again around 7 pm for meetings, so it worked out perfect. On the weekend, the Farmers Market is located directly behind the Loft, which was a good deal. Definitely would definitely recommend and hopefully it will be available next year on our annual trip to Staunton, VA.

review_text: Two close friends and I stayed here for a weekend getaway. You can't beat the location: Laurie's place is within easy walking distance of everything in the historic Staunton downtown area, including restaurants, shops, the Shakespeare theater, and the Amtrak station. The apartment itself feels like an artist's loft. It's cozy, clean, and very pleasant to stay in. My friends and I were quite comfortable sleeping one to the bed, the air mattress Laurie provided, and the sofa. Laurie also went out of her way to get us some information on local restaurants and transportation, which we really appreciated! We would be happy to stay here again.

name: Ty

,

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The Loft was fanTASTic! Like all of the other reviews say, location was excellent. Hostess Laurie was off the charts.
Staunton has some nuanced public parking arrangements, but it is really very simple, and Laurie's explanation makes it very clear.
Laurie happens to be the proprietor of Newtown Bakery. Newtown Bakery (bread, sweets, pasta, pizza,etc) should be on your list of places to stop for breakfast or dinner. It was a big hit with our crowd, locally and organically sourced, priced reasonably, and without any pretentiousness.
I had personal distractions up until the time we left, so I ended up hitting Laurie with a dozen questions abiut Staunton logistics at the last minute just before our trip. Her grace, patience and results-oriented responses were more than I could have or should have expected.
Thank you for virtually holding my hand, Laurie! You typify the best of AirBnB!

There are several breakfast and coffee options, and a gorgeous neighborhood to walk through along the way. Add Cranberry's to your agenda if you are interested in delicious vegan/vg/gluten-free options!
We will absolutely return to this fabulous Airbnb in the (near) future. We are still talking about the beautiful space and the host's generosity with her talent.

It was a great distance from everything. Everything was walkable.
Just be mindful of the other people in the building, as conversations can be heard through the doors since it's an older building with gaps in the doors.
The spiral staircase was a challenge, but we got used to it after the 1st day. There is a bigger staircase in the back that will take you to the 2nd floor directly into the bedroom, but we couldn't get it open.
The little kitchen was adorable and we loved the provided kcups!
The tv has access to different streaming platforms if you have your own & sign into it.
The free laundry room was very convenient and appreciated.
Cute place!
Food recommendations:
Breakfast: Cranberry's Grocery & Eatery
Lunch: The Depot Grille or Byers Street Bistro
Dinner: Mill Street Grill
Sweet: Clocktower Eats & Sweets

There is a white noise machine but just a flag for those who prefer earbuds instead. So if I stay there again I will bring earbuds. The mattress was firm and comfy overall great stay can’t complain.

review_text:
Jeremy’s place was an absolutely wonderful stay! Though we were only there for 1 night, it definitely left an impression due to the extreme cleanliness, thoughtful layout, cozy atmosphere, and great location.
It has a nice, relaxing, and genuinely comfortable couch/living room/TV area and we LOVED that both the bedroom AND bathroom were upstairs so we didn’t have to traverse down in the middle of the night — that’s rare for the loft-style and was much appreciated. The bed is also SO comfy, but bring a sleep mask if you’re light-sensitive (the streetlights bleed in). We also loved the thoughtful touches to make our night easier, like a white noise machine, ceiling fan, and easy charger plug ins for both sides of the bed.
The location was easy to find and is very walkable to numerous quaint locations around Staunton and would be a great central location for any newcomer. We would recommend this place to anyone and would love to stay here again!

Great location, central to everything, clean, comfortable. Loved having a living room/kitchen and watching Netflix on the TV downstairs before going upstairs to the sleeping area. The bed was quite comfortable (bonus, it's a posturpedic so you can raise up in the morning while you drink coffee:). It's a block from The Shack, which was maybe the best dinner I've had in VA. Jeremy was so easy to communicate with and obviously understands hospitality. Thank you to Jeremy and Desiree, we will 100% be back!

review_text: Very cute spot near some great local spots. Quiet for the most part and in a residential, sleepy area with little traffic. Bed is on the firmer side, but still comfortable if you prefer a softer mattress. We were staying here for an event in Harrisonburg and found the drive really easy. Great restaurants and local coffee places nearby the apartment. Boboko in Harrisonburg was fantastic. This is a perfect “home base” to explore the area from.

rating_info:

September 2021
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text: Wonderful! We loved staying at this comfortable and beautiful place! It is obvious that Jeremy, the owner, has put an exceptional amount of effort into making this a special place. There are adorable throw pillows and ample soft blankets, which made the space feel comfortable and like home. The decor was beautiful and everything was exceptionally clean. The bed linens were high quality and very comfortable. The body wash, shampoo, conditioner, dish soap, and hand soap provided were all high quality and mostly organic products. There are several options for coffee: Keurig (with several pods of coffee, tea, and hot chocolate provided), drip coffee, and French press! There’s even a coffee grinder! Bring your beans! Jeremy has really thought of all you could need! We had a few questions and Jeremy was very helpful and extremely prompt and professional with communication. Lastly, the place is close to everything downtown. We had an easy walk to all the shops and restaurants including the Woodrow Wilson Museum and house and the Shakespeare theater. Highly Recommended! We will definitely stay again if in the area!

name: Dan
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
March 2024
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: My dog and I enjoyed our stay in Staunton. The Traveler's Nook is small, but was the perfect size for the two of us. If you intend to walk around, be advised the area is hilly and steep. Going downtown takes about 14 minutes, but the return walk is almost entirely uphill. The neighborhood is quiet, but the building is split into multiple units. While I didn't have neighbor noise, I could hear every squeak of the floorboards as well as the vacuum when cleaning was occurring. That didn't disturb us, except the floorboards in the Nook are squeaky and I was concerned every noise I made carried into other units. The space was well kempt and comfortable. My only complaint is about the kitchenette. It was well stocked and had what I needed, but the faucet is extremely shallow. Any time I wanted to wash dishes or use the sink, I had to hunch down underneath the oven hood, which was uncomfortable. All in all, I got what I needed for my brief writer's retreat and would stay again.

This unit was perfect as our base of operations for the 3 day Staunton based portion of the 2023 Bike Virginia cycling tour. It was only a short to historic downtown Staunton and just a few miles in any direction to beautifully scenic Shenandoah Valley countryside.
The unit was as described. The bedroom was tight, but comfortable and cozy. The kitchenette was small, but functional. Made use of the washer/dryer that was available in the basement Always nice to move on with clean laundry.
We had a great meal at the Mill Street Grill. We also ate at the Depot Grill. It was good, we liked Mill Street more.

Very communicative hosts and very clear on instructions and having a guidebook provided is so helpful. Would stay again!

Rating, 5 stars

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The space is exactly as described and was a good fit for our needs.
Pros: Christi allowed us to check in 2 hours early and we were very appreciative. I had asked the day before about early check in, but did not get a response. I followed up the next day and was told we could check in early. We appreciated that. Also, it was easy to check in.
Cons: The dogs upstairs barked for almost 2 hours, but we didn’t let the hosts know in hopes they would return and the barking would stop. Once we reached out, she apologized and immediately sent someone to take care of them.
Ultimately, we decided to cut our stay short. We did let her know as soon as we checked out. There was no response for several hours, which was fine that time as we didn’t need anything.

Stayed with a pet
review_text:
We stayed here on the last night of a 12-day road trip from NJ to New Orleans with our pup, Samson, and it was perfect for our needs! We got in later than expected and frazzled from a long drive, but the entry was simple, the back porch was a great spot to sit and enjoy the fresh air, and the little living room gave us a chance to decompress before heading to bed. Speaking of which, the bed was super comfortable, and I loved the USB outlets in the headboard!!
In the morning the pups upstairs and next door were a bit excited about Samson’s presence, so he and I enjoyed a short walk to the Mary Baldwin College campus, with great views of the mountains outside town. Overall it was a welcome respite from a long drive, and I would definitely stay again the next time we are traveling on I-81.

review_text: If you plan to spend time in downtown Staunton, this is a great spot to stay! It was a short and straightforward walk downtown. Considering you are staying in a basement apartment in an old house, you do hear lots of noise (foot steps, dog barking) from upstairs. The backyard is fenced in which was nice for our 2 dogs, however, there was lots of poop so watch your step! Overal, a good deal.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: A lovely home and a great space. The bed was SO COMFORTABLE, I could find what I needed, and You will find your hosts are welcoming and helpful without a hint of “too much”. It was just the rest I needed after a tough trip. Staunton is a lovely town, everyone is friendly, from shopkeepers to the restaurant chefs, too the people you meet along the way. Zynodoa is an amazing farm to table experience. I tried the tasting menu and the wines were curated perfectly with the dishes presented…I ordered a “to go” cornbread to bring home to family. I spent an afternoon reading and swimming at one of the lovely parks in town. Visited Polyface Farm…gorgeous working farm with the best sustainably raised pastured pork, chickens, grass fed beef, rabbit and eggs. An educational experience…if you’re interested in how your food should be grown, you should at least look up some videos from Polyface. I love listening to and reading most of Joel Salatin’s books. All and all a wonderful stay at the perfect location.

And the location was pretty great being in in a neighborhood, yet next to Mary Baldwin’s beautiful campus with views of the town below, and within walking distance to downtown for meals and shopping. There were some initial family noises like barking dogs and piano practice from above, but it was all quiet and calm by the time I returned from dinner. Just makes it feel more like home!

The short climb to the top of the hill is worth walking for the views. I also had fun watching the farm animals - pigs, goats, ducks, chickens, and guineas plus their dog and cats. I can only imagine how glorious the place is in the spring.

It was a perfect place for our weekend getaway! Jeremy met us when we arrived and gave us the lay of the land including a summary of the many critters on their farm. We loved meeting Annie the Golden Retriever, Marie Curie the long-haired cat, Marley the chill pig, and the ducks, goats, chickens and guinea hens. Their farm is quiet and peaceful but just a short drive from the restaurants and attractions. We absolutely loved seeing a play at the American Shakespeare Center's Blackfriars Playhouse--don't miss it!
The Firefly Cottage is comfortable, private, and pleasantly decorated. If we get back to Staunton we'd definitely stay there again.

Definitely on our short list of places to revisit.

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Our first visit to Staunton, & we can't imagine a better location for exploring the wonderful downtown area! This property is right in the heart of it all, with so many restaurants, breweries & shops within walking distance. We parked our car on Wed., & didn't move it until we left on Sun. (We were able to park on the quiet 1-way street in front of the property, but the parking garage is right across the street.)
The space is comfortable, & very clean. The downstairs has a sofa, tv, bar area, desk, & (pleasant surprise!) a half bath. The full bath, kitchen and bedroom are upstairs.
Hosts were super responsive & accommodating. I'd highly recommend!
[Other recommendations: Ciders from Mars-we sampled & enjoyed everything; Byers St. Bistro-excellent crab dip, prime beef sandwich, Happy Hippy pizza (sub sausage for artichoke), & strong/reasonably priced drinks; Shenandoah Pizza-pizza by the slice, meatball sub; Ubon-tasty Thai in a quirky setting, & the owner Ubon is a hoot!]

The unit itself is one of my favorite AirBnBs ever. It was so welcoming and intriguing! Lots of great natural light upstairs, and an awesome little kitchenette (with the coolest dang mini German oven/range/hood combo from the 70s). I would recommend to a friend in a heartbeat (already have, actually!) and 100% plan to return if I find myself in the area again. Truly a treat!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This was an absolutely lovely place to stay! So unique. It's very special to have a whole storefront to yourself--the bar downstairs was great fun, and the bedroom was beautiful and full of light. We stayed midweek and didn't hear much noise from the streets, and they had a white noise maker just in case. Perfect location for visiting Blackfriars Playhouse -- it was just a very short walk away. We also walked to a delicious quiche breakfast at the Pampered Palate around the corner and a tasty dinner at Zynodoa. Checkin/checkout was simple, and the parking garage (that they provide a pass for) is literally right across the street. Highly recommend.
(Note: if you're hoping to sleep in late and are light sensitive, the upstairs has a LOT of windows. There are blinds and curtains, but the curtains are a bit thin so it was quite bright by 7:30am in the summer. All the light is beautiful but just something to note.)

Stayed a few nights
review_text: What a wonderful place to stay. As great as the pictures make it look. But hands-down the best thing is the location. So great to be able to stop back at your place and drop off what you just bought. So great to have 12-second walk to the best croissants outside of France (Reunion Bakery). So great to be a block away from Beverly street which they close on the weekends and make a pedestrian thoroughfare and all the restaurants spill out into the street. Oh, wait, am I writing a review for Staunton or this place? Staunton is a fantastic place to walk around and enjoy the architecture, shops, restaurants, art galleries, and coffee shops, but getting to stay right in the very middle of it all makes this place ideal (so long as you are good with going up and down stairs since your bedroom is on the second floor.) Wait, actually, don't tell anyone, I want it to be available next time we come :-)

review_text:
This “very small hotel” is charming in so many ways and is wonderfully furnished for a couple such as us. It contained everything we needed for an enjoyable stay. Jamie was an outstanding host whose good taste and understanding of visitors’ practical needs were reflected throughout the unit. She provided helpful information before and after our arrival and responded quickly whenever we had questions. She was exceptionally helpful in arranging for anniversary flowers waiting for my wife when we arrived.
The location of this AirB&B was perfect for exploring Staunton’s shopping, dining, cultural and entertainment opportunities which are all within easy walking distance. And the parking garage is just across the street.
We have stayed at many AirB&B locations in Europe and the U.S. over the last 5 years. This was one of the very best experiences we’ve had with AirB&B thanks to its location, design, and, especially, its host, Jamie. We highly recommend it to others planning a stay in Staunton.

Stayed one night
review_text: The Storefront was such a unique stay! We loved the space. It was nice having two whole floors to ourselves with the skylights upstairs and the huge window downstairs seeing the people walk by. The bar area was really cool. Everything you need for coffee in the morning is provided. It's right in the middle of where all the shops and restaurants are so you don't need the car once you park it. The parking is convenient with the parking garage right across the street. We didn't even need the parking pass provided as it seems on weekends the parking garage was free. The only downside of the stay was dealing with the clicking sound in the ceiling upstairs. If you are a light sleeper, this may be an issue. However, once we determined it had to do with the HVAC ductwork, we turned the heat down low and just used the fireplace and space heater downstairs. It kept the downstairs nice and warm. Upstairs was much warmer than downstairs so having the heat turned down low wasn't an issue there.

This rental is exactly as advertised -- absolutely perfect for people who really want to be in the middle of everything and love the charm of historic buildings. We loved the convenience of the location, and the people watching from our own living room (the living room is essentially a storefront in DT Staunton). The kitchen (upstairs) is very nice and well supplied. We were able to cook full meals easily, when we didn't feel like walking a couple of blocks to some great restaurants and bars. The half-bath on the first floor is a great convenience. One of Staunton's public parking decks is directly across the street from the unit, and a parking pass comes with the rental. Couldn't be easier.
Jamie and the rest of the team is VERY responsive and accommodating. We had a wonderful time and would be excited to return soon.

Would definitely try and stay here again on our next trip to Staunton. People were all so friendly in town.

We walked across the street, through the garage where our car was parked, up the alley and we were there! We also had a short walk to dinner and enjoyed walking the blocks around the area marveling at the architecture. It would be a great town for a movie set. The bed was comfortable and the fridge upstairs in the kitchen has a full fridge so we were able to freeze our cooler ice blocks. Just a tip, push hard on the door in warmer weather to open it after entering your code. I thought the lock wasn't working but it was just the door sticking. Nice and clean!

Rating, 5 stars

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Wow - what an excellent stay in Staunton, Virginia.
For starters, you'd be hard pressed to find an affordable place to stay with such an amazing location. Staying here, you are blocks away from being in the heart of a downtown that features incredible restaurants and a diverse selection of storefronts. The location alone is worth the stay.
Next, what an incredibly unique interior that is cozy enough for 1-2, but makes you want to host for 7-8 people. The bar area downstairs was equally stylish and polarizing. I found myself wanting to stand behind the bar with a towel on my shoulder serving my parents and telling stories. An incredibly cool touch.
The Storefront was incredibly clean and stylishly decorated. The skylights leading upstairs give off incredible light as well. Having two bathrooms is a definite perk. Communication with the hosts was fast, informative, and easy.
Would absolutely recommend staying here to anyone, and I say that with a bit of caution as I do not want to give away a hidden gem.

The unit was everything I thought it would be and more. The decorations were colorful, happy and beautifully arranged. The master bedroom was truly romantic and spoke to my inner “Hippy”!
We were also blown away by the historic village with its great shops and restaurants… not to mention the amazing architecture of all the neighborhood homes.
We will definitely be back, making Staunton, VA a regular stop on our annual East Coast Road Trip!

name: Amanda
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
September 2023
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
This is our 4th year visiting Staunton - this was by far the best stay we have had. The apartment was spotless. Very cozy. The décor was very nice. I really can't overstate how clean the apartment was.
They provided everything you would need. Small snacks, coffee, toiletries, and makeup remover wipes.
The location is perfect. Just a short stroll to the main part of downtown to the stores, restaurants, and train station .
I liked that they had a smart tv so we could log into all our favorite streaming channels. Also very cool that the tv is on a moveable stand so it's away most of the time. Encourages cozy reading - instead of tv time.
We alerted the host to a minor maintenance issue (not something we needed fixed during our stay), they responded right away and were very kind and responsive.
We will definitely be back and we are looking forward to staying at other locations offered by the same host.

The area is also very lovely and walkable. It has an artsy feel to it and a ton of hidden treasures to discover! Highly recommend Blackfriars Theater for a great show, Made and the antique stores for some shopping, and Sweet Addie’s and Wright’s for delicious meals.
This stay goes above and beyond what I expected!

name: Barbara
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
July 2023
,
·
Stayed over a week
review_text:
I've fallen in love with Staunton, & my time in this house is one big reason why. When the description says "steps from" awesome Blackfriars Playhouse & the cute downtown, they mean it -- like 2 minutes around the corner (& equally close in the other direction from the excellent restaurant The Shack). The decor is exactly as pictured, which might be over the top for some people, but it fed my soul & I turned on those twinkle lights every single evening. The little kitchen worked well for this solo traveler to cook up some farm-fresh meals. Thanks to the provided guide to area things to do, I tried two amazing hikes that were new to me despite having visited Shenandoah many times as a kid. (Crabtree Falls, my goodness, go see it!) This apartment even has a nice deep bathtub that was great for soaking my post-hike muscles.
If the Bohemian Suite is unavailable next time I'm craving a Shenandoah Valley fix, I'll (pout but) look into another one in the same house. Loved staying here.

rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
June 2023
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
You can't beat the location — right around the corner from the busy streets and slightly out of the way, but easily accessible to everything. The decoration is a little intense, but the apartment is overall quite comfortable.
A couple of things to be aware of: the apartment door doesn't have an inside lock or bolt beyond the one opened with the keypad. There is no dining table, so this is probably not the place to do a lot of cooking/eating (but with all the restaurants downtown, probably not a huge issue). And finally, there's a lot of Christian symbolism in the decoration (crosses, etc.), so if you're not comfortable being surrounded by that, probably better to find another spot.

The Victorian style house in which the apartment is located is surrounded by other houses with similarly unique and beautiful period architecture, We were only there for one night so we didn't get a chance to use the kitchen, but it seemed well equipped. Not that you will want to cook much, with all the eat out or carry-in options in town. Check-in was easy and Michaela was a perfect host. We will be back!

review_text: The Bohemian Suite in Staunton is just wonderful. My wife and I visited for a few days and really enjoyed our time. The place is well cared for and very conveniently located. The charm of Staunton is amplified by this laid back and well-designed Victorian home. As with any home it has quirks. This is an older home with creaky floors and not perfectly aligned doors but, the owners have done a fabulous job of updating and decorating these suites. During our stay we had everything we could need to make us feel at home. You can feel confident that should any issues arise during your stay you will have all the support you need, in a caring and helpful manner. I highly recommend that you give the Bohemian Suite a stay. We did and will again.

name: Débora And Nathan
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
December 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The Bohemian Suite is definitely unique in style! Every little detail was creatively inspired for a comfortable and cozy set up and atmosphere.
Location is excellent!! Within walking distance to the historic district/downtown; very convenient and we didn’t have to worry much about parking.
The rooms are segregated and well equipped with all the necessary amenities for a short stay. The TV with streaming service is a nice and convenient addition!
The only negative point for us is that the cleaning fee is inconsistent once you see the checkout process with a few cleaning requests for guests to do in preparation for the cleaning crew. We always do our best to leave the spaces in order upon our departure, facilitating the work for hosts, but a considerably high cleaning fee with additional requests on the way out doesn’t really make sense to us and, in the end, the checkout process isn’t as smooth as it should be, especially when you’re on vacation and trying to have a relaxing time.
Other than that, the stay was delightful and we truly appreciate all the extra touches!

name: Brigette
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
August 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: I have stayed in 3 different properties in Staunton over the years and Staunton Stays was by far the best. The suite was comparable to a 1-bedroom apartment in size with large, whimsically decorated rooms (I was in the Boho Suite). The bed was very comfortable, and I loved lounging in the window seat or reading on the front porch. The suite was equipped with many of the small details that I often find missing in other accommodations. For instance, there was a nightlight in the bathroom, a space to put my toiletries bag, and 2 hooks for towels. I don't cook, but if I did, the kitchen seemed well-equipped. Cleverly, the TV was on a wheeled stand, so you could watch it in either room, but it was not obtrusive if you preferred to read. The property was very quiet, and the locks worked just as described. Michaela is very responsive. It is ideally located close to both Beverley Street and the Wharf area. I will definitely stay here again, and I highly recommend it for anyone looking for a place in Staunton.

name: Michael
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
August 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The Bohemian Suite is the perfect place for a short stay in Staunton. The quirky, eclectic, and interesting decor made it a unique place to stay, but the truly great thing about it was the location. It’s no more than a few minutes walk from anywhere you might want to go. Our suite was quiet, comfortable, and reasonably clean, given the number of “tchotchkes” there. The welcome bottle of wine awaiting our arrival was a very nice touch.
The only negatives, and they were not serious ones, were: (1) There is no real table to sit at if you want to eat in. There are snack tables, though. That said, the absence of a real table is clearly revealed in the photos of the Bohemian Suite on Airbnb, so no surprises there. (2) We would have liked to have a bar of shower soap rather than the little bottle of shower gel that was barely enough for two people, two nights.
Finally, a suggestion. Since the Bohemian Suite is a place of public accommodation in which no one regularly resides, the two small crucifixes (one atop the refrigerator and the other in the bathroom) could be off-putting to guests not of the Christian faith.
All in all, we would certainly try to book the Bohemian Suite for our next stay in Staunton and we would highly recommend it to anyone looking for short-term accommodations there.

review_text: Oh my gosh, how awesome was our stay! Our Bohemian Suite was beautifully and thoughtfully decorated, with color everywhere and an invigorating atmosphere. We loved chilling on the front porch with wine or coffee, or sleeping in in the comfy bed. But there's tons to do in Staunton and the suite is steps away from the Shakespeare theater and a cute coffee shop, as well as easily walkable to just about everywhere else. All the amenities one could want are there: K-cups, dishes for cooking, and even a clean, spacious laundry room, which was helpful because we stayed for a week. There's a great "manual" with suggestions for restaurants and even hiking trails (which we took advantage of) and it's clear the owners adore Staunton, and they want to share all this lovely town has to offer. Definitely book here!

review_text: One of the best Airbnbs we’ve ever stayed in! The suite was cozy and colorfully decorated. Lots of space and felt like a home away from home. Downtown Staunton is a cute mountain town and just a three minute walk away. While Staunton may not be a three day visit on its own on a random weekend in the winter, it was a perfect home base to see Natural Bridge, caverns, hiking the blue ridge tunnel, snow tubing at a resort, visiting Charlottesville, and a winery. You can make an unforgettable weekend here. The Staunton restaurants are great bookend to every day too. And during bad weather, this suite was an ideal place to curl up with a book, watch a movie, or just relax. Highly recommend.

There was enough space that half of us could work in one room while the others slept. Fast WiFi, nice bath soaps in the bathroom. Michaela is also good about providing coffee, granola bars, and even a bottle of wine when you arrive. The apartment is a short walk to lots of other delicious food and drink. I love unwinding in Staunton, and the Bohemian Suite is a great place to do it!

Stayed one night
review_text: We thoroughly enjoyed our quick overnight stay at Katie’s place! The space itself is very clean, quiet, safe, really nicely decorated, and spacious. It has a nice porch and also a couple of chairs in the lawn where you can sit and observe the wide variety of farm animals. The really great thing about Katie’s is that in addition to watching the animals from afar, you can also see them up close, just on the other side of a fence. They are all friendly and some will let you pet them or scratch their chins (we were fortunate to chat with Katie when we arrived and she let us know that this was an okay thing to do). There were also friendly cats and dogs and chickens that welcomed attention! The location is quite convenient to I-81 and the downtown of Staunton is just a few minutes drive away; there you can find plenty to see and do. A stay in a clean, quiet place with plenty of animal friends is my ideal stop - I wouldn’t hesitate to stay at Katie’s place again!

review_text: Jeremy, the co-host we believe, was extremely rude at checkin. My wife and I were planning on staying at their Airbnb over the holidays to visit family. We had picked up a family member to help us carry in our things because we had our newborn infant and could use some extra hands. Jeremy did not even give a greeting before he very rudely asked how many people were staying. He then proceeded to seem surprised or upset that we had our infant despite our reservation clearly saying we would have our infant. Jeremy then seemed to be upset that we showed up at 4:15 despite the checkin time being between 3-10 PM. Furthermore, we noticed that Jeremy was watching us out of his window that faces the parking when we were returning from being with my family one night. Overall, Jeremy was not a friendly host at all and not welcoming. Unfortunately, Katie was much more polite but we only saw her once. We were very disappointed with our stay, especially since it was over the holiday.

review_text:
Adorable modernized 1900s studio “spring house” on “working farm”. (Read ‘space description’ and ‘house rules’)
Close to I-81; watch for inclined left driveway. Private; exact as pictured. Arrived late aft; host Jeremy warmly greeted us, along with free-roaming chickens and one of their friendly cats. Jeremy reviewed and expounded on rules and property. Suggested restaurant “Gloria’s Pupuseria” for dinner, of which we went and it was fab!
Other pros: Comfy bed, nice linens/towels, great/hot shower, pet all their farm animals but one, field with a vista—even a cave, to view. Historic lovely downtown; rolling hills surround.
Cons: House rules state “working farm”—loved, that! But, not seeing their chickens allowed to roam their AB&B business guest’s parking and space entrance areas. Pray hosts have attended to this as you read this!Coffee/sugar; but no creamer, or tea. Dead bugs in bathroom light/fan fixture. No ceiling/wall fan in living/bed area.

My girlfriend and I loved waking up or coming back to the Springhouse after a long day and just watching the animals interact. When we would head out for the day, we would turn off the AC, and the Springhouse would stay cool all throughout the day until we came back. It was such a cozy little place and an amazing experience to be there. I highly recommend staying here to enjoy what Staunton has to offer and for a nice stay away from the hustle and bustle of town.

The cottage’s proximity to downtown Staunton and the nearby festival we were attending made this the perfect respite and landing spot for our weekend. I knew from the moment our host introduced us to the farm cats that it was going to be a welcoming place. The bed was very comfortable, the accommodations were clean and cozy, and the hosts were accessible. It was fun being warbled at by a confusion of fretting Guinea hens…and to our credit, we opted against startling the fainting goats. Would definitely return if we need an overnight near Staunton.

Stayed one night
review_text: Clearly marked parking in the driveway...and once we walked over to the cabin, we were able to see the gorgeous surroundings. Easy to use code to open the door and there was great layout inside. The bed was super comfy for two people with the all-important fuzzy blanket and fluffy pillows. Hook to hang coat, place to put wet boots, well-appointed kitchen nook, and clean updated bathroom. We felt so relaxed at Katie's cabin and were blessed with listening to a rain storm (great sounds from the roof!). Also easy to use WiFi and nice television. Really, the "Firefly Springhouse" is worthy to be a destination in itself. If you are an animal lover, there are opportunities to see chickens, kitties, pigs and all sort of photo opportunities as well. This is beyond the best AirBnB we've ever stayed in and the real reason an AirBnB can be superior over any other traditional accommodation. HIGHLY RECOMMEND.

Simply said... Katie's place was the best AirBnB Experience we've ever had. Looking for a place to escape the rain after a camping trip, we booked Katie's place just as a crash pad. She accepted our reservation quickly, gave clear instructions, and the room and bathroom were clean, cute, and comfortable. Waking up in the morning to the farm animals (goats, pigs, chickens, ducks, silly cats) and a dewy morning made me want to stay there at the little farm forever. Katie was around to answer questions about the animals, give dining recommendations, and she has very smart and responsible children who help care for the animals.
Anyways, it was beautiful, with fantastic food options in town, and I would give more than 5 stars if I could. THANKS KATIE!

review_text: We've stayed at dozens of AirBnBs, and this was one of the best. We were blown away by our stay at Katie and Jeremy's family farm. The surroundings are absolutely gorgeous, with views of rolling hills in the distance and several unique and magical features built in the early 1900s. We were lucky to be greeted by Katie and one of her daughters who introduced us to their friendly animals. The springhouse, where we slept, is very comfortable and well equipped. We enjoyed an evening stroll around the property petting the animals, followed by a rest in the hammock and outdoor chairs. Mid-week shopping and dining in Staunton was surprisingly fun, and we plan to return with our bikes soon. When we return, we will absolutely book another stay at Katie and Jeremy's family farm. Highly recommended!
